title: Rate law for oxidation of HBr by O2

content.question:
<math alttext="2 H B r gas plus O 2 gas react to produce H 2 O 2 gas plus B r 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
Based on a kinetics study of the reaction represented by the equation above, the following mechanism for the reaction is proposed.
Step 1: <math alttext="H B r gas plus O 2 gas react to produce H O 2 B r gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Br</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="H O 2 B r gas plus H B r gas react to produce 2 H O B r gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Br</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>HBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HOBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) Step 3: <math alttext="2 H O B r gas reacts to produce H 2 O 2 gas plus B r 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HOBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) 
Which of following rate laws is consistent with the proposed mechanism?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H B r squared, times the molar concentration of O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[HBr]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H B r, times the molar concentration of O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mtext>HBr][</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H O 2 B r, times the molar concentration of H B r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Br][</mtext><mtext>HBr]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H O B r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HOBr]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H B r, times the molar concentration of O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mtext>HBr][</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
